medical_history.chief_complaint: Anophthalmia, congenital hypopituitarism, diabetes insipidus, and bilateral cleft lip and palate.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was born at term with bilateral anophthalmia, bilateral cleft lip and palate, and micropenis. Persistent hypoglycemia developed in the first few days of life and was controlled by continuous nasogastric feeding. At 24 days of age, hypernatremia and polyuria were observed, leading to a diagnosis of diabetes insipidus. Daily episodes of hyperthermia without signs of infection were noted in the first 3 months, and at 3 months of age, the patient presented with bacterial meningitis secondary to otitis media.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Panhypopituitarism confirmed at 6 days of age. Daily episodes of hyperthermia, bacterial meningitis at 3 months, and frequent episodes of otitis media were also recorded.
medical_history.family_history: The patient was born to consanguineous healthy Afghan parents and has three healthy siblings.
